Content:
No, because you do this within the OH_HydraulicPress class. OH_HydraulicPress will inherit GetInventory() from ItemBase. That's why it is available within your OH_HydraulicPress class.

I'm not a professional programmer, so if some of the terms here aren't quite correct, please forgive me.

With `ItemBase Nugget` you create a new Object of ItemBase called "Nugget". And with `ItemBase.Cast( )` you can convert a Type into another. And `GetInventory().FindAttachment( slot_id )` will look for the Attachment within the slot with a specific ID (slot_id) of the class where you call it... in this case of OH_HydraulicPress.

So you create Nugget und you tell it to be the Gold or the Copper item, that's attached to you Hydraulic Press.

The only difference to the "original" is, that "Nugget" has only the Functions of ItemBase, because we said, that Nugget is an ItemBase Object. But that is enough, because we want to use some basic ItemBase Functions of Nugget... like GetQuantity or IsInherited.
